name: Four Seasons Hotel Las Vegas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have been to Las Vegas at least 20 times over the years, direct flight from Pittsburgh, we used to stay at different hotels ending lately at the Belliago, UNTIL this trip for Easter and stayed at The Four Seasons. The service at The Four Seasons is over the top perfect! We had Presidential Limo. pick us up and take us back to the airport $100 round trip, they were great/prompt. From the minute we exited the car, the attendant at Four Seasons reconized us by name, we checked into our room at 10am. The room was good, great bed, nice bath, nothing to complain about but nothing special, view of pools and mountains, there are nicer rooms in Vegas. Breakfast at the Veranda was perfect, the best eggs I have eaten... we ordered lunch by the pool all 3 days, ordered something different each day and each meal was better than the next, loved the Tuna 3 Ways. The pool attendants were incredible, 8 attendants each day, the pool area is small size so 8 attendants make you feel like everyone gets personal attention. Free ice water w/ lemon that is constantly refilled, evian spritzers on your face, fresh fruit and fruit juices of the day, sunglass cleaning, fresh towels galore, mini massages for your feet and hands, 15 minutes for $35, 30 miniutes for $65 and 45 minutes for $95 include your hands, worth getting every day. We ventured over to Mandalay Bay on day (for 15 minutes) way to crowded, we loved our little corner of the world at Four Seasons. We had SPA treatments 2 days, loved the Dessert Oasis so did my husband. A taxi to Ceasars Shops was only $11+ tip so even though you are at the far end of the strip it's a cheap taxi ride. Here is the best description that my husband came up with, The Four Seasons is "old money" not necessarily but the Point behind the saying is true, the Belliago where we've stayed (and loved) is "new money". The attention to detail at Four Seasons and the quality of guests are top notch. All the guests were friendly, chatty and we were probably one of the "poorest" (everythings relative) couples there. We will definately be back.
reviews.title: 5 Star Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for Xmas / New Year (2nd year running), Once again stayed in a Suite and whilst expensive it was worth every penny. The hotel is an absolute bastion of calm, quiet and elegance.
reviews.title: An Oasis

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely spa, the only downside is they don't do manis / pedis.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, expensive but worth every penny

reviews.text: Charlie Palmers serves perfect steak. The valet has your car in a couple of minutes. Rooms are warm and comfortable. Perfect!
reviews.title: Another quality stay at FS

reviews.text: Beautiful hotel for fist 4 nights of our honeymoon. It's not cheap but you get what you pay for. We loved the fact that it doesn't have a casino and is consequently much quieter than the majority of Vegas hotels. Also,being at the airport end of the strip, it's just not as busy. We stayed in a Premier Strip View room which did indeed have the most amazing view of the strip. We were treated to the most fantastic "free" firework display on New Years Eve which we watched from our room on the 18th floor. The service at this hotel is faultless. Roomservice plates were removed the second they were placed outside the door. The whole hotel was immaculately clean. We ate in the Veranda restaurant one evening and the meal was beautiful with attentive service. Everything you would expect from a 5 star Four Seasons hotel.
reviews.title: Ultimate Luxury in Las Vegas
Relaxing
reviews.text: It was very refreshing to walk in the hotel in Vegas with peace and quiet surrounding you. There is no casino, no loud music, no smoke and no people.

I had a deluxe room with a huge bathroom. It was clean and nicely appointed. There was a flat screen TV with lots of movies to order. They also had a DVD player so you can just watch your own stuff. I had breakfast room service, which was prompt and food was delicious. I had a very nice dinner at Verandah. There is also Charles Palmer steakhouse in the restaurant but I didn't eat there.
reviews.title: Good but some issues

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had couple of treatments in the spa. They were all relaxing and enjoyable. The pool is getting renovated until March, so I didn't get to experience it.
reviews.title: Truly Outstanding

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is definitely the place to be for people who want to get away from all the craziness of Vegas. But if you want to gamble, just take the main elevator to Mandalay Bay casino.
reviews.title: Great Hotel -- A little away from the craziness

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was very happy that we chose to stay at the Four Seasons but might think twice about staying here again. Here's the good and the "areas for opportunity". For the most part, service and atmosphere were excellent. Only one exception was dealing with a staff member trying to resolve a billing error. It was unnecessarily difficult and uncomfortable to fix thanks to a not-so-pleasant front desk receptionist. Otherwise, it was refreshing to be treated so well. Christian, a bell stand staff, and May in reception were very pleasant and professional. We paid $100 to upgrade to a larger room. We did not get a strip view. Instead we got a lot of airport noise (starting at 6am Sun-Wed, 5am on Thurs). We were also next to an ice machine/room. A few times during the night we were woken by the noise (either a door slamming or the ice machine). The bed was very nice but not as comfortable as the Signature beds or the LV Westin beds. The rooms were wonderful though. We did have room service several times. Dinners were good but breakfast was overdone and way over -priced. The room service orders were always correct (yay) but we always had to ask for the bill. The server never offered it. It was very nice to have special access and separate elevators to the Mandalay Bay area. Kudos to the staff though for really making our stay pleasant.
reviews.title: Only worth it for the view and tranquility

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Four Seasons in Las Vegas is a heaven away from the terrible crowd - because the For Season doesn't have a Casino directly attached (there is one - but it belongs to the Mandalay Hotel and is accessed through the 1st floor). This means: no long waiting for valet parking, no endless waiting for check in, concierge etc.
reviews.title: No Casino Hotel - fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Four Seasons has its own entrance and its own pool but it's on top of the Mandalay Hotel (of which you feel nothing). Just be careful when making the reservation: some rooms have "airport view" (hotel directly located opposite the airport) and are very, very noisy - especially when the fighter aircrafts take off. We got such a room the first night. But after I called the reception we got a free upgrade to a "Strip-View-Room".
reviews.title: A beautiful haven away from the crowds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The concierge has been very helpful, a "more-than-5-stars-experience": we reserved tickets for LOVE at the Mirage. But picking them up has been a shock: 1 - 1.5 hours waiting! So I canceled and went back to the Four Seasons. At a tip they arranged that the tickets were brought directly to the hotel so we could spend the day for better things than waiting in row. Also the recommended restaurants (Brio...) has been very good, the tours...
reviews.title: Hospitality from personnel was wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Valet Parking had also been great. The car always had been there already when we turned up.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel with great service but...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Except the noisy part of the rooms I can't say anything bad about the Four Seasons. In case we go to Las Vegas again certainly we would stay there again.
reviews.title: Lovely stay - and that bed!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I have stayed at various Four Seasons. While Las Vegas was not the most modern, it was certainly pretty, clean, and perfectly located. We enjoyed being set apart from the business of Las Vegas but close enough to hop down to the Mandalay Bay casino.
reviews.title: Great location but not best Four Seasons (must get a deal)

reviews.text: We stayed on the Las Vegas special and left on Sunday. On Saturday, I discussed extending our stay through Sunday evening and staying until Monday with a front desk person. She said that we could stay on the same reduced rate and that we could make our decision at any point. My husband called very early on Sunday morning and was told that he could not match that offer and in fact, the rate was much higher. Given the occupancy of the hotel - we were confused. We ended up leaving for another hotel where we got a much better rate. We were also annoyed to find that valet parking was $19.00 day - this was not clearly indicated anywhere and every other hotel in the area offers this service free. We would have self-parked if we had known. Last, I don't understand why internet service is $14.00 at the Four Seasons but free at virtually every low budget hotel. This is a dated expense and should be updated - not to mention that we were double-billed for it (which was later corrected).
reviews.title: Should have been better
Perfect stay at the Four Seasons Vegas
reviews.text: The pool was gorgeous and if we return, the pool will be the reason. Overall, it was a good location with well-kept grounds but we felt as if we were being nickeled-and-dimed quite a bit.

This was my first stay at a Four Seasons. I stayed at the Four Seasons Easter Weekend. I was assigned a room with a pool view. The Associate at the front desk was top notch, while the Associate at check-out was impersonal. The hotel has an understated scent of luxury. The room, on the 38th floor, was clean and in perfect condition. Room Service staff were cheerful and polite. The front desk spa staff seemed to be from a casting call of Sunset Tan - valley girls. Compared to the Canyon Ranch Spa at the Venetian, the spa lounge is tiny. Here is why I didn't give this hotel 4 or 5 stars - each morning the jets across the freeway would start their engines at 6am - I was taking some time off and didn't want to get up at 6am. ugh. I'm taking some time off around Memorial Day in Arizona and decided to stay at the JW Marriott Camelback instead of the Four Seasons - didn't want to take a chance that my quiet would be distrubed.
reviews.title: Absolutly Wonderful - Brilliant!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading the great reviews of this hotel, we decided to check rates on the internet. The hotel was running a "3rd night free" prromotion, so we ended up paying an average of about $189 per night, which put as around the same pricepoint as any of the other high end strip hotel.
reviews.title: Welcome change from most of Vegas

description: Set on the world-famous Las Vegas Strip, Four Seasons Hotel Las Vegas offers newly renovated luxurious accommodations and unparalleled service with direct access to the adjacent Mandalay Bay Resort & Casino and the city's signature action and night life. Private PoolFour Seasons Hotel Las Vegas is home to a lushly landscaped private pool and during the warmer months offers signature amenities such as passed frozen fruit and chilled Evian Spritz. Guests also have access to Mandalay Beach, which includes a wave pool, lazy river and real sand. Stylish sophisticationLocated on floors 35-39 of the Mandalay Bay tower, Four Seasons' newly renovated guest rooms are stylish and sophisticated, reflecting the energy and glamour of Las Vegas. Floor-to-ceiling windows offer sweeping views of the glittering Las Vegas Strip and surrounding desert scenery.
